title: Sleeping Alone
lyrics:
(We’re rolling)
(Alrighty)
Counting constellations on the popcorn ceiling
And staring at your picture on the wall
Rays of lonely moonlight slowly slice through the blinds

As the tears begin to fall



I’m tired of sleeping alone

I just want to be where you are

Tired of saying goodnight through the phone

And waking up each morning in the dark

Better say a prayer

Turn out the light

As I hug my pillow tight

I’ll be with you soon my dear

If only in my dreams



Who I am trying to fool, baby?

I’m the one to blame

For the forces keeping us apart

I’m stubborn and I’m bold

And works got me in a stranglehold

Keeping a vice around my heart

Indifference over distance

Don’t fare well

Maybe a goodnight kiss from you

Would break me from my spell



Cause I’m tired of sleeping alone

I just want to be where you are

Tired of saying goodnight through the phone

And waking up each morning in the dark

Better say a prayer

Turn out the light

As I hug my pillow tight

I’ll be with you soon my dear

If only in my dreams



Ah, here we go again

Off to Neverneverland



Better say a prayer

Turn out the light

As I hug my pillow tight

I’ll be with you soon my dear

If only in my dreams



Better say a prayer

Turn out the light

As I hug my pillow tight

I’ll be with you soon tonight

If only in my dreams
